title: How to Set Up a Nintendo 3DS

steps.headline: Charge and turn on the system.
Perform the 3D calibration.
steps.description: Move the 3D depth to the uppermost position and then touch NEXT. Look directly into the 3D screen. Allow a distance of 25–35 centimeter (9.8–13.8 in) between your eyes and the screen, and then touch "activate 3D." The images on the top screen should now be in 3D. Use the 3D depth slider to adjust the 3D effect to a comfortable level and tap "done."

steps.headline: Set the date and time.
steps.description:
Touch the arrows to set the date and tap "OK."
Follow the same method to set the time.

steps.headline: Create your profile.
steps.description:
Enter a username using the on-screen keyboard and tap "OK."
Tap the arrows to indicate your date of birth. Select your country or region of residence, and then tap "OK."

steps.headline: Choose whether you want to set up your Internet connection or not.
steps.description: Tap the robot icon at the bottom of the touch screen for help.

steps.headline: Check the parental controls if you are setting up the 3DS for a child.
steps.description: This is a step for parents! If child is under 7 years old, you should deactivate the 3D to prevent eye damage in young children.

text:
Charge and turn on the system.  Select your language.  Perform the 3D calibration. Move the 3D depth to the uppermost position and then touch NEXT. Look directly into the 3D screen. Allow a distance of 25–35 centimeter (9.8–13.8 in) between your eyes and the screen, and then touch "activate 3D." The images on the top screen should now be in 3D. Use the 3D depth slider to adjust the 3D effect to a comfortable level and tap "done." Set the date and time. Touch the arrows to set the date and tap "OK."
Follow the same method to set the time. Create your profile. Enter a username using the on-screen keyboard and tap "OK."
Tap the arrows to indicate your date of birth. Select your country or region of residence, and then tap "OK." Choose whether you want to set up your Internet connection or not. Tap the robot icon at the bottom of the touch screen for help. Check the parental controls if you are setting up the 3DS for a child. This is a step for parents! If child is under 7 years old, you should deactivate the 3D to prevent eye damage in young children.
